title: Access the Wegweiser Kommune (WWK) Open Data API
Access the Wegweiser Kommune (WWK) Open Data API
text: example retrieve data births deaths Cologne Munich, tidying retrieved data visualizing data using ggplot2:
code: library(wwkapir) library(ggplot2)  # Get data on births and deaths for Cologne and Munich csv <- wwk_export(   indicator = c("geburten", "sterbefaelle"),   region = c("koeln", "muenchen") ) dat <- wwk_read_csv(csv) #> ‚Ñπ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. #> Warning: One or more parsing issues, call `problems()` on your data frame for details, #> e.g.: #>   dat <- vroom(...) #>   problems(dat)  years <- paste(range(dat$year), collapse = " bis ") regions <- paste(unique(dat$region), collapse = " und ") ggplot(dat, aes(x = year, y = value, color = region, group = region)) +   geom_line() +   scale_color_manual(     values = c("#DC143C", "#87CEEB")   ) +   facet_wrap(~indicator) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(legend.position = "top") +   labs(     title = "Geburten und Sterbef√§lle",     subtitle = sprintf("%s, %s", regions, years),     x = NULL, y = NULL, color = NULL,     caption = "Quelle: Bertelsmann Stiftung/www.wegweiser-kommune.de"   )

title: Access the Wegweiser Kommune (WWK) Open Data API
text: Wegweiser Kommune initiative Bertelsmann Stiftung offering open data information support local authorities Germany. covers topics demography, education, finances, health, sustainability.

title: Access the Wegweiser Kommune (WWK) Open Data API

text: Function return WWK data retrieved csv format tidy tibble.

title: Read WWK CSV files ‚Äî wwk-read-csv
code: wwk_read_csv(file, skip = 2, n_max = Inf, show_col_types = FALSE)  wwk_read_csv_indicator(file, skip = 2, n_max = Inf, show_col_types = FALSE)

title: Read WWK CSV files ‚Äî wwk-read-csv
text: file Either path file, connection, literal data (either single string raw vector). Files ending .gz, .bz2, .xz, .zip automatically uncompressed. Files starting http://, https://, ftp://, ftps:// automatically downloaded. Remote gz files can also automatically downloaded decompressed. Literal data useful examples tests. recognised literal data, input must either wrapped (), string containing least one new line, vector containing least one string new line. Using value clipboard() read system clipboard. skip Number lines skip reading data. comment supplied commented lines ignored skipping. n_max Maximum number lines read. show_col_types FALSE, show guessed column types. TRUE always show column types, even supplied. NULL (default) show column types explicitly supplied col_types argument.

title: Read WWK CSV files ‚Äî wwk-read-csv
text: tibble

title: Read WWK CSV files ‚Äî wwk-read-csv
text: CSV files returned WWK API used directly analyses, contain: Lines metadata beginning end data set. first line contains names indicators. second line contains names regions. Additional meta data provided end. data returned wide format: row corresponds indicator. first column contains name indicator. columns contain data region-year pair.

title: wwkapir: Access the Wegweiser Kommune (WWK) Open Data API ‚Äî wwkapir-package

title: wwkapir 0.0.0.9000
text: Add pkgdown website. Add wwk_suggest_xxx() family functions get suggested values filter demographic type, regional key, population range region type. Add wwk_read_csv_indicator() read csv data returned wwk_export_indicator() tidy tibble. Add wwk_export_indicator() retrieve meta data indicators. Add wwk_demographic_types() get list available demographic types tidy tibble. Add wwk_read_csv() read csv data returned WWK API tidy tibble. Add wwk_get_xxx() family functions retrieve meta data single indicator, region topic. Add wwk_api() browse specification WWK API.
